wikipedia_page.main:
Tufton Victor Hamilton Beamish, Baron Chelwood  (27 January 1917 – 6 April 1989) was a British Army officer, Conservative Party Member of Parliament for Lewes (1945–1974), and author.
During the Second World War, he served in France, Belgium (1940), Malaya (1942), India and Burma (1942–43), North Africa and Italy (1943–44). In 1940 he was awarded the Military Cross; was knighted in 1961 and upon his retirement from the House of Commons was created a life peer as Baron Chelwood, of Lewes in the County of East Sussex on 7 May 1974.Beamish's father was Tufton Percy Hamilton Beamish, who served in the Royal Navy until 1925 when he retired with the rank of rear admiral. He had followed his career in the navy by entering politics and served as the member of Parliament for Lewes from 1924 until 1931 and again from 1936 until 1945, when his son succeeded him.
Beamish's daughter, Claudia Hamilton Beamish, was elected Member of the Scottish Parliament for South of Scotland in 2011.

response: * January 27 – Tufton Beamish, Baron Chelwood, British army officer and politician (d. 1989)
* April 6 – Tufton Beamish, Baron Chelwood, British army officer and politician (b. 1917)
*Tufton Beamish, Baron Chelwood of Lewes (1917–1989) son of the above; British Army officer and member of Parliament for Lewes
*Tufton Beamish, Baron Chelwood of Lewes (1917–1989) son of the above; British Army officer and member of Parliament for Lewes (1945–1974)

Rear-Admiral Tufton Percy Hamilton Beamish, CB, DL (26 July 1874 – 2 May 1951) was an English naval officer and Conservative Party politician. He married Margaret Simon in 1914.  The couple had two daughters and one surviving son, Tufton Beamish, Baron Chelwood.
